title: About
text:
Motivations



I’m motivated by the opportunity to use research and data to support environmental sustainability and community engagement. My work spans ecological connectivity studies, climate-focused social science research, and conservation analyses, where I apply tools like R, ArcGIS, QGIS, Graphab, and Excel to study environmental challenges and identify actionable solutions.
Equally important is translating research into practical, community-driven impact. As a leader in the Leave No Trash University Challenge, I organized participation across multiple universities and communicated environmental data in accessible ways to inspire sustainable behaviors.
Ultimately, I am driven by connecting research with action, whether analyzing ecological systems or supporting initiatives like Leave No Trash, so that science leads to tangible environmental benefits and resilient communities.

 Leave No Trash Student Group - Leading a global university-based initiative to properly dispose of waste to create cleaner communities.
 Poster presentation at CURC (Celebrating Undergraduate Research and Creativity).



Beyond My Work



Outside of research and environmental projects, I enjoy exploring the outdoors with friends through hiking, camping, and skiing in areas near and far.
Ultimately, my interests beyond my work and education fuel my passion for sustainability. They remind me that impactful environmental work is not just about data, but also about the relationships, experiences, and communities that surround it.

 Hiking The Narrows in Zion National Park
 Skiing (or more so falling) somewhere in Canada
 Hammocking over a stream during a camping trip

title: Resume
text:
Education
Professional Science Masters in Ecosystem Science and Sustainability – Colorado State University
Concentration in Climate Adaptation and Risk Management | December 2026

title: Resume
text:
Project Management & Communication Experience
Graduate Student Coordinator – MURALS, Office of Inclusive Excellence, CSU | Sep 2025 – May 2026
- Facilitated research-skills workshops for undergraduates, improving scientific literacy and supporting abstracts, posters, and oral presentations
- Coordinated volunteers and event logistics for a large-scale academic research event
- Provided mentoring on research design, communication, and project development
- Supported inclusive engagement by connecting with Cultural Resource Centers and helping students identify opportunities to participate
Student Leader – Leave No Trash University Challenge – CSU | Spring 2025
- Organized participation across 15+ CSU student organizations and supported leaders at 20+ universities globally
- Communicated environmental data (litter statistics, pollution impacts) in accessible formats
- Contributed to community-based sustainability outcomes through large-scale clean-up efforts
Climate Justice Communication – CSU | Fall 2024
- Researched climate-change impacts on Indigenous communities in Queensland, Australia, and Niugtag, Alaska
- Produced written, verbal, and creative communication materials on climate justice
- Conducted policy and vulnerability analyses aligned with resilience and environmental justice frameworks
Composting Educational and Curriculum Development – CSU | Fall 2024
- Developed sustainability-focused educational materials for diverse age groups and community audiences
- Conducted research on barriers to composting and integrated findings into module design
Yellowstone National Park Tourism Environmental Analysis – CSU | Fall 2024
- Assessed environmental issues and performed resilience analyses to identify vulnerabilities and management strategies
- Evaluated tourism-environment interactions and developed sustainability-focused recommendations
- Delivered findings through poster and oral presentations

title: Resume
text:
Research Experience
Sustaining Connectivity of the Greater Sage-Grouse – CSU SUPER Program | Aug 2024 – May 2025
- Conducted climate-focused ecological connectivity research under warming scenarios and conservation-area classifications
- Performed geospatial and statistical analysis using QGIS, R, Graphab, and Excel
- College Honors Award – Presentation of research poster at the Celebrate Undergraduate Research and Creativity (CURC) Showcase
- Published Communication Art Piece – Journal of Undergraduate Research and Scholarly Excellence
Natural Area Perception Social Science Research – CSU | Spring 2024
- Conducted surveys on use of natural areas in Fort Collins, well-being, and access
- Evaluated data using social science techniques, including Q-sort methodology

title: Macey Dvorak
text: Hi, I’m Macey Dvorak, an emerging environmental professional specializing in climate adaptation, carbon management, and ecosystem sustainability. I’m currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Ecosystem Science and Sustainability at Colorado State University through the Professional Science Master’s program, with anticipated graduation in December 2026, and I hold a B.S. in the same field with a minor in Diversity and Inclusion in Natural Resources. My work spans ecological research, climate justice communication, sustainability-focused curriculum development, and community-based initiatives, using geospatial and statistical tools such as R, ArcGIS, QGIS, and Excel. Across research, education, and project coordination roles, I focus on research-informed decision-making, inclusive education, and science communication that supports both communities and ecosystems.
